sub_title: VIce President of Access  Network Strategy at Liberty Global
summary: For over 25 years, Seamus has worked in various engineering, operations and technology positions in the Broadband communications industry.  In his first 4 years as a professional engineer, he participated in Research and Development as part of the European Union funded RACE and ACTS programs in Broadband network and Digital TV R&D dealing with both HFC and Broadband Wireless networks from 2.5GHz to 60GHz. For the last 20 years, Seamus has worked for UPC and Liberty Global and has been involved in architecting, engineering and operating large scale access network infrastructures delivering voice, interactive video and broadband services to 10s of millions of customers across 15 European markets

education.field_of_study: Bachelor's  degree in Electronics and electrical engineering

profile_positions.description: Reporting to The MD of Network & Shared operations, Seamus leads The Access Network Department with responsibility for driving the Access technology roadmap, including virtualisation of CMTS/CCAP platforms and digitizing Access transport optics through deploying a Converged Interconnect Network supporting RPHY/HFC, XGS PON FTTH, B2B and mobile backhaul. He is also responsible for creating and executing an Access innovation plan and creating the long term capacity demand plan and associated long range Capex plan for access networks and platforms along with delivering architectural frameworks for all new access network and platform technology being deployed in The Liberty Global group of companies.
profile_positions.title: VP Access Network Strategy

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Chief Network Officer, Seamus led the Central Access Engineering team with responsibility for the construction, engineering and maintenance of Liberty Globals HFC networks across 12 countries in Europe along with the engineering and operations of the Broadband DOCSIS platforms.
profile_positions.title: VP Access Engineering

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the CNO and/or CTO of UPC Broadband, Seamus worked in the European headquarters of UPC Broadband and was responsible for ensuring the  high quality delivery and performance of UPC's HFC network infrastructure, both New Build and Upgrade across Europe along with the roll out and implementation of DOCSIS 3.0 platforms in 10 operating countries across Europe supporting over 10 million broadband customers. Seamus also conducted technical due dilligence to support the company's pre and post M and A activity in Switzerland, Romania, UK, Germany and The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: VP Access Engineering,  UPC

profile_positions.description: Reporting at various times to the Vice Presidents of Engineering and Broadband Services, Seamus was responsible for developing the strategy for migrating from legacy cable modem platforms to standards based DOCSIS platforms across 10 European countries.  He was also appointed Vice Chairman of the UPC IP NDA (Network Design Authority) and in this capacity he was responsible for creating and communicating the UPC Pan European DOCSIS and HFC engineering guidelines along with driving network standardisation by ensuring their implementation across the footprint.
profile_positions.title: Director Broadband network engineering,  UPC

profile_positions.description: Worked in the delivery of R and D in a number of RACE and ACTS programs related to Digital TV, VoD, Computer supported collaborative working and advanced IP networking.  Projects included BRITEUR, BOURBON, DIMMP, DIAMOND, RENAISSANCE and  GAIA. Lead various consultant assignments for the Irish cable industry and the International wireless cable industry.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Engineer
